snippet: BuzzFeed, the social Web site, said on Monday that it had raised $15.5 million in financing. The announcement was made less than a month after BuzzFeed named Ben Smith, a standout writer from Politico, its editor in chief.
abstract: BuzzFeed, the social Web site, said on Monday that it had raised $15.5 million in financing. The announcement was made less than a month after BuzzFeed named Ben Smith, a standout writer from Politico, its editor in chief.
lead_paragraph: BuzzFeed, the social Web site, said on Monday that it had raised $15.5 million in financing from New Enterprise Associates, Lerer Ventures, Hearst Interactive Media, Softbank and RRE. The announcement was noticed in media circles partly because it was made less than a month after BuzzFeed named Ben Smith, a standout writer from Politico, its editor in chief. Read more »
